segment.source: Settings Dialog Box - Settings Tab (Windows 10)
segment.target: Settings Dialog Box - Settings Tab (Windows 10)

segment.source: To display the Settings dialog box, in Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), on the Tools menu, click Settings.
segment.target: To display the Settings dialog box, in Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), on the Tools menu, click Settings.

segment.source: Settings Dialog Box - Settings Tab
segment.target: Settings Dialog Box - Settings Tab

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: To display the Settings dialog box, in Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), on the Tools menu, click Settings.
segment.target: To display the Settings dialog box, in Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), on the Tools menu, click Settings.

segment.source: In the Settings dialog box, on the Settings tab, use the following controls to modify the settings for your ACT database and ACT Log Processing Service.
segment.target: In the Settings dialog box, on the Settings tab, use the following controls to modify the settings for your ACT database and ACT Log Processing Service.

segment.source: SQL Server
segment.target: SQL Server

segment.source: Lists the database server name for the SQL Server database server that contains your ACT database.
segment.target: Lists the database server name for the SQL Server database server that contains your ACT database.

segment.source: Click Browse to search for available database servers.
segment.target: Click Browse to search for available database servers.

segment.source: A Select Server dialog box appears from which you can select the database server that contains your ACT database.
segment.target: A Select Server dialog box appears from which you can select the database server that contains your ACT database.

segment.source: Database
segment.target: Database

segment.source: Lists the database name of your ACT database.
segment.target: Lists the database name of your ACT database.

segment.source: Change
segment.target: Change

segment.source: Opens the user interface where you can create, open, or migrate an ACT database.
segment.target: Opens the user interface where you can create, open, or migrate an ACT database.

segment.source: This computer is configured as a Log Processing Service
segment.target: This computer is configured as a Log Processing Service

segment.source: If selected, indicates that this computer is used for the ACT Log Processing Service.
segment.target: If selected, indicates that this computer is used for the ACT Log Processing Service.

segment.source: Clear this check box to use a different computer to process the logs.
segment.target: Clear this check box to use a different computer to process the logs.

segment.source: If there is no designated ACT Log Processing Service, log processing defaults to the local computer.
segment.target: If there is no designated ACT Log Processing Service, log processing defaults to the local computer.

segment.source: Log Processing Service Account
segment.target: Log Processing Service Account

segment.source: Specifies the account information, including the account type and account credentials, to be used to start the ACT Log Processing Service.
segment.target: Specifies the account information, including the account type and account credentials, to be used to start the ACT Log Processing Service.

segment.source: The account must have read and write access to the ACT database.
segment.target: The account must have read and write access to the ACT database.

segment.source: For information about setting up database permissions for the ACT Log Processing Service, see Troubleshooting ACT Database Issues.
segment.target: For information about setting up database permissions for the ACT Log Processing Service, see Troubleshooting ACT Database Issues.

segment.source: Log Share
segment.target: Log Share

segment.source: Specifies the absolute path to the ACT Log Processing Service share where log files are processed.
segment.target: Specifies the absolute path to the ACT Log Processing Service share where log files are processed.

segment.source: Click Browse to search for a location.
segment.target: Click Browse to search for a location.

segment.source: The Share as box automatically updates to show the directory name.
segment.target: The Share as box automatically updates to show the directory name.

segment.source: For information about ensuring that all computers can access the share, see Troubleshooting the ACT Log Processing Service.
segment.target: For information about ensuring that all computers can access the share, see Troubleshooting the ACT Log Processing Service.

segment.target: Related topics
